name: Adornes

reviews.text: Stayed for three nights during Easter holidays with my husband and two children (aged 12 and 10) and had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We had a family room which was more than big enough for us with lovely views over the canal. The breakfasts were a feast and the children very impressed with the hot chocolate. Staff both at breakfast and on reception were incredibly helpful, particularly with recommending wonderful restaurants and places to go. The free bikes are a wonderful idea and we all throughly enjoyed the day we spent cycling around Bruges and up the canal to Damme. Will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, perfect location and wonderful staff

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Hotel Adornes. We were very pleased by the location and the service. The room was simple and the bathroom fairly basic, but we had a great view of the canal and were a quick walk to the Market Square. After walking all day, it was nice to have a quick walk back to the hotel without worrying about cabs or buses. I appreciated the internet access and the hotel's willingness to hold luggage. The included breakfast was delicious, and the breakfast room was charming. For the price point, I was surprised by how comfortable this hotel was.
reviews.title: A charming, small hotel in a nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights last week. First of all, the city is magical but the location of the Hotel Adornes is beyond belief. We had a canal view room and you can see three canals from it. It's residential and quiet at night. The breakfast room is charming and the selection very adequate. The room was spotless and comfortable. Every staff member we dealt with was kind and helpful. I'll certainly dream about being there.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful old buildings along a close-in (but not central) canal combine to make this charming hotel. The small room is truly tiny and very simply--but adequately--furnished. Comfortable bed. Only a tub, no shower. Great hospitality and generous (and delicious) breakfast. We took every recommendation our hosts gave, and were delighted each time. Next time, however, we'll go for more antique style and luxury.
reviews.title: Welcoming but minimal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to go to the Memling Museum--a handful of paintings that will blow your mind.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with superb service - a real home from home!

reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is its management. Rik and all the staff are really nice and helpful, and make everything to ensure the best possible stay for their guests and provinding us with excellent advice relating restaurants, tours, museums, etc. They even spoke excellent Spanish!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At arrival, we were upgraded to a bigger room, with separate beds for our comfort. The only shame was that the room was on the ground floor, facing the road, and was a little bit noisy. Otherwise, the room and bathroom were extremely clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Staff ensured our stay was perfect
Wonderful Hotel in a Beautiful City
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the price, and was abundant and well prepared.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was also included in the room rate, and they let us leave the car after check out (11 am) until our departure, at 6 pm.
reviews.title: Lovely and perfect!

reviews.text: A shame that we coudn't use the (also included) bikes, due to our lack of time.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The Adornes, the staff, the breakfast, and the free loaner bikes....all made us hate to leave. Bruges is such a gem, and the hotel made it even better. Our room (#17) had wonderful canal views and was very big.
reviews.title: I Wish I Could Give it a Six

reviews.text: The staff literally went out of their way to ensure our every need was met and question was answered. They gave top notch sightseeing advice and restaurant tips. I will not stay in another hotel in Bruges when I return.
reviews.title: Good location, Friendly staff - Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The breakfast is the perfect way to start the day. Healthy, hearty, and delicious. They really put out a full spread of Belgian treats. The coffee was awesome.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In two short days, the girls at the front counter became like friends and they seemed genuinely interested in our comfort and satisfaction.
reviews.title: Very comfortable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled with our little baby, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Yes, it is a bit pricy and not a 5 star luxruy hotel, but I feel that I paid a little bit more for a peace of mind. Would recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Perfect location, very friendly staff, would go back in a shot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel with local character. Staff was very helpful. Left for an early train expecting to miss the breakfast. Staff would not hear of it and prepared something for us the night before to make sure that we "started the day off right".
reviews.title: Great hotel with personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at Adornes Hotel. We would definitely go back and wouldn't stay anywhere else. They went out of their way to help us with everything we asked for and more. I emailed back and forth several times before we left and they were always prompt with replies and very informative with answers. Here are some facts about Adornes.
reviews.title: Very Accommodating! Great Hotel!!

description: Quiet location, along one of Brugge's most beautiful canals, at 10 minutes walking from the heart of the centre. A personal welcome, comfortable rooms, an extensive buffet breakfast and not to forget free use of our bicycles, free underground parking and free internet !
